solution_line_template: In the second month, Vinny lost half as much as he had the first month, so he lost {first_month_loss} pounds / 2 = <<{first_month_loss}/2={second_month_loss}>>{second_month_loss} pounds.
In the third month, he again lost half as much which was {second_month_loss} pounds / 2 = <<{second_month_loss}/2={third_month_loss}>>{third_month_loss} pounds.
And in the fourth month, he lost {third_month_loss} pounds / 2 = <<{third_month_loss}/2={fourth_month_loss}>>{fourth_month_loss} pounds.

So in total, Vinny lost {first_month_loss} + {second_month_loss} + {third_month_loss} + {fourth_month_loss} = <<{first_month_loss}+{second_month_loss}+{third_month_loss}+{fourth_month_loss}={total_first_four_months_loss}>>{total_first_four_months_loss} pounds in the first four months.
Over his entire diet, he had lost {initial_weight} - {final_weight} = <<{initial_weight}-{final_weight}={total_loss}>>{total_loss} pounds.
So in the fifth month, Vinny must have lost {total_loss} pounds total loss - {total_first_four_months_loss} pounds loss in the first four months = {fifth_month_loss} pounds.
